title: What is the name of the chord for “seventh flat ninth piano chord” (piano, chords, chord theory, music)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do you mean a dominant 7th with a flatted ninth ? If you do then I have just gievn the name for it ! , there is no other nomenclature that applies . If you meant a minor chord structure —so for something like Cmin7b9 , again the description is all you need .
7(b9) occurs diatonically in the minor mode without any alteration. If you wrote C7 in the key of F minor, its 9th would be Db.
